title: 'Will cross that bridge': India on US 500% tariff threat over Russian oil import
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar voiced concerns over the US threat to impose a 500% tariff on countries trading with Russia, including India. US Senator Lindsey Graham's proposed bill targets nations like India and China, accusing them of supporting Russia's war efforts through oil purchases. India has significantly increased its Russian oil imports since the Ukraine invasion, capitalizing on discounted prices.

title: 'Took selfie, left chilling msg': Man enters woman's home posing as delivery agent, rapes her
content: In Pune's Kondhwa area, a 22-year-old woman was allegedly raped in her home on Wednesday evening by an unidentified man posing as a courier delivery executive. The man gained entry while the woman was alone, claiming to have a delivery. Police are investigating the incident, reviewing CCTV footage, and have registered a case.

title: Honeymoon murder rerun? Newlywed gets husband killed to keep 15-yr affair with uncle alive
content: In Bihar's Aurangabad, a 45-day-old marriage ended tragically with the murder of Priyanshu Kumar Singh, allegedly orchestrated by his wife, Gunja Singh. Motivated by a desire to continue her long-term affair with her maternal uncle, Gunja conspired to eliminate her husband, drawing inspiration from the Meghalaya honeymoon murder case.

title: Mother, teenage son stabbed to death in Lajpat Nagar home; probe on
content: A shocking double murder occurred in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar. Ruchika, 42, and her son Karsh, 14, were found dead in their home. Police discovered the bodies after family reported a locked door. Both victims suffered fatal injuries from sharp weapons. Ruchika's husband alerted the authorities. The police are investigating, gathering evidence, and reviewing CCTV footage.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Is Lord's Test more important than the series?': Sangakkara questions decision to rest Bumrah
content: India's decision to rest Jasprit Bumrah for the second Test against England has drawn criticism, especially from former players like Kumar Sangakkara, Ravi Shastri and Dale Steyn. With India trailing 0-1 in the series, the team management's decision to stick to a pre-decided plan of resting Bumrah has raised questions about their approach to crucial matches and team selection strategy.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role in this
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: Slapgate: K'taka senior cop seeks VRS after CM's public slap gesture
content: Narayan V Baramani, Additional SP of Dharwad, has sought voluntary retirement after a public incident in Belagavi where Chief Minister Siddaramaiah gestured to slap him. Baramani, with 31 years of service, cited humiliation in his VRS request, submitted a month ago. Despite attempts by the CM and Home Minister to dissuade him, Baramani awaits the government's decision on his plea.

title: Who is Soham Parekh? The mysterious 'Indian techie' who has US start-ups riled
content: Soham Parekh, an Indian techie, faces accusations of deceiving US startups by simultaneously holding positions at multiple companies. This sparked controversy after founders exposed inconsistencies in his resume, location, and availability. The incident ignited debates about remote hiring practices, ethical conduct, and transparency within the tech industry, leading to widespread discussions and memes.

title: 'What are they waiting for?': Trump erupts as US House dithers on 'beautiful bill'
content: Donald Trump has expressed his frustration with Republicans in Congress over delays in passing his tax and spending bill, dubbed the "One Big Beautiful Bill." The bill faces opposition from both fiscal conservatives concerned about the rising national debt and moderates worried about potential re-election consequences due to healthcare cuts.

title: ‘He has been humiliated’: Musk’s ex-friend amid billionaire's feud with Trump
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Elon Musk and Donald Trump, Philip Low, a former friend of Musk, suggests that Musk feels humiliated and will actively work to undermine the former president. This follows Musk's criticism of Trump's policies and Trump's veiled threats of deportation. Musk has hinted at escalating the conflict but is currently refraining from doing so.

title: Chess | Carlsen takes a fresh jibe at Gukesh - 'In terms of impressing me...'
content: Magnus Carlsen, after the first day of the SuperUnited Croatia Rapid & Blitz 2025, acknowledged Gukesh's improvement but stated he's yet to be truly impressed by the young Indian chess players. He praised Praggnanandhaa's recent classical tournament wins, highlighting his consistent performance.

title: Sharp contrast! How top e-commerce stocks Swiggy & Eternal are outshining Chinese counterparts
content: Indian e-commerce giants Swiggy and Eternal are outperforming domestic indices and Asian peers, fueled by the rapid growth of quick commerce. This sector, projected to reach $100 billion by 2030, sees established players like Swiggy, Zomato's Blinkit, and Zepto maintaining market dominance due to efficient delivery and established supply chains, contrasting with challenges faced by Chinese counterparts.

title: 'System killing farmers': Rahul Gandhi attacks Centre over ryot suicides
content: Rahul Gandhi criticizes PM Modi, stating farmers are increasingly burdened by debt and government indifference, referencing farmer suicides in Maharashtra and waived loans for billionaires. He also raises concerns about India's reliance on Chinese fertilizer imports, highlighting shortages and lack of government preparation to support domestic production, questioning whose progress is actually being prioritized.

title: No AI without immigration: Zuckerberg’s 11 new hires in superintelligence
content: Meta's new Superintelligence Lab showcases the significant role of immigrants in America's AI leadership. The lab's 11 top AI researchers, all immigrants from countries like India, China, and the UK, previously contributed to OpenAI, DeepMind, and Google.

title: Delhi HC stops Patanjali from running 'disparaging' ads against Dabur Chyawanprash
content: The Delhi high court has restrained Patanjali from airing advertisements that allegedly disparage Dabur Chyawanprash. Justice Mini Pushkarna issued the order following Dabur's objection to an ad featuring Swami Ramdev questioning the authenticity of other Chyawanprash products.

title: 'Always shaking': Over 900 quakes jolt Tokara Islands within two weeks
content: A remote island chain in southern Japan has been rattled by over 900 earthquakes in two weeks, causing fear and sleeplessness among residents. While no major damage has been reported, the Japan Meteorological Agency cannot predict when the tremors will cease. Residents are advised to prepare for potential evacuation as seismic activity remains high, reminiscent of a similar earthquake wave last year.

title: Flying 40-year-old aircraft, but old cars banned: Ex-IAF pilot questions Delhi govt's move
content: Delhi's ban on refueling older vehicles, targeting those over 10 (diesel) and 15 (petrol) years, faces criticism from ex-IAF pilot Sanjeev Kapoor. He questions the policy's focus on personal vehicles while older aircraft, trains, and buses continue operating. Kapoor also warns of potential black markets arising from the fuel ban, raising concerns about unintended consequences.

title: ‘Confirm he’s the father’: Puka Nacua’s girlfriend seeks custody, expenses
content: Los Angeles Rams' Puka Nacua faces legal issues. Hallie Aiono, his former partner, filed a petition. She seeks paternity confirmation and full custody of their unborn child. Aiono also wants financial support for pregnancy and legal fees. Nacua has not responded publicly. This situation could become a high-profile legal fight as he returns to Rams camp.

title: Red Panda injured in WNBA halftime fall: Pat McAfee relays health update
content: Red Panda, the renowned halftime entertainer, suffered a fractured wrist during a WNBA Commissioner's Cup Final performance after a unicycle malfunction. Following the fall, she received immediate medical attention in Minneapolis, with Lynx staff providing support. Pat McAfee shared an update from her team, expressing gratitude for the outpouring of support and well-wishes as she heads home for further treatment.

title: Taylor Swift surprise act rocks Tight End U: Kelce beams with pride
content: Pop sensation Taylor Swift surprised everyone at Tight End University event in Nashville. Travis Kelce planned this secretly. Swift joined Kane Brown on stage. She performed her hit song “Shake It Off”. Kelce revealed Swift prepared backstage. She impressed everyone with her impromptu performance. Fans admired Swift and Kelce's supportive relationship. The event became unforgettable due to Swift's electrifying presence.

title: China targets India's mfg sector, delays machinery delivery, pulls iPhone engrs
content: Tensions with China are disrupting India's manufacturing sector as China delays machinery deliveries and pulls its citizens from Indian factories, including those at Apple's contract manufacturer, Foxconn. This is happening alongside new restrictions on magnet exports to India, impacting automobile and electronics production.

title: Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes nine sixes - collects India U19 record
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive 86 off 31 balls propelled India U-19 to a four-wicket victory over England U-19. The 14-year-old's innings included nine sixes, setting a new record for an Indian batter in youth ODIs. His 20-ball fifty is the second-fastest by an Indian in this format, contributing significantly to India chasing down the target of 269 in a rain-shortened match.

title: Amarnath Yatra: Key things devotees need to keep in mind
content: Following the tragic Pahalgam attack, the Kashmir Police issued an advisory for the 2025 Amarnath Yatra, emphasizing travel in designated convoys from Bhagwati Nagar, Baltal, and Nunwan base camps. Pilgrims are advised to arrive reasonably close to their scheduled yatra date.

title: Air India Delhi-US flight halts mid-way, hits snag; flyers disembarked
content: An Air India flight AI103 en route from Delhi to Washington, DC, was grounded in Vienna due to a maintenance issue discovered during a scheduled fuel stop on July 2. The onward journey to Washington was cancelled, and passengers were disembarked.

title: Microsoft confirms 9,000 job cuts amid AI pivot; Xbox division likely impacted
content: Microsoft is set to eliminate up to 9,000 positions, about 4% of its workforce, impacting various divisions including Xbox. This decision aligns with a substantial $80 billion investment in AI infrastructure and the appointment of AI pioneer Mustafa Suleyman. Despite layoffs, Microsoft's stock remains strong, reflecting a strategic shift towards AI and long-term competitiveness.

title: Zuckerberg 'kicked out' of Oval Office? What really happend
content: Mark Zuckerberg's unannounced entry into an Oval Office meeting between President Trump and military officials caused a stir, leading to concerns about security protocols. Zuckerberg was reportedly asked to leave due to clearance issues while sensitive topics were being discussed. A White House representative disputed the account, stating Zuckerberg's visit was brief and pre-arranged.

title: 'Developed a kill list': US Capitol rioter gets life sentence; plotted to bomb FBI office
content: Edward Kelley, a military veteran and Capitol riot participant, received a life sentence for plotting to bomb an FBI office and assassinate agents. He created a "kill list" with images of targets and shared it with an accomplice.

title: Smriti Irani reveals her mother was made to leave home because she could not have a son
content: Smriti Irani shared personal stories with Karan Johar. She recounted her mother's struggles after being asked to leave home. Irani also addressed pay parity in the television industry. She highlighted Ekta Kapoor's focus on setting new standards. Irani's show, Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, is set to...

title: IND vs ENG 2nd Test: Boundaries shortened to counter two-spinner plan?
content: Concerns arose at Edgbaston regarding the unusually short and asymmetrical boundary dimensions for the second Test, with some boundaries seemingly 5-10m shorter than usual. This sparked speculation about whether the adjustments favored England's aggressive batting approach against India's spin attack, reminiscent of the 2019 World Cup controversy when India faced similar boundary issues at the same venue.

title: Gold & silver price prediction today: Will gold rate test Rs 99,000 mark soon
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold prices are surging towards ₹99,000, fueled by global cues and safe-haven demand amid geopolitical tensions and inflation concerns. Silver is also bullish, eyeing ₹1,10,000, driven by industrial demand from green energy initiatives and expectations of central bank rate cuts. Experts advise a buy-on-dips strategy for gold above ₹96,500 and maintaining silver above ₹1,05,500 for potential gains.

title: 'Important to speak up': India calls out West for not backing its stance on terror
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted that the India-Pakistan ceasefire was negotiated between their respective DGMOs. He criticized the West for their lack of support towards India concerning terrorism. Jaishankar emphasized the need for consistent global action against terrorism, urging nations to support victims regardless of location.

title: Pak celebrities' social media accounts banned again, just a day after being made visible
content: Social media accounts of Pakistani actors, including Mawra Hocane and Yumna Zaidi, were briefly visible in India. These accounts were quickly banned again following a legal request. The All Indian Cine Workers Association (AICWA) strongly objected to the reappearance. They sent a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressing their concerns.

title: Global dark web drug empire busted in Delhi’s backstreets
content: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) dismantled a transnational drug trafficking syndicate smuggling controlled medicines across four continents. Operation "Med-Max" led to eight arrests and seizures, exposing a network spanning over 10 countries. The syndicate used encrypted platforms and cryptocurrency, with a kingpin operating from the UAE. Investigations revealed a clandestine pill-manufacturing facility in Australia, now dismantled.

title: US strikes set back Iran's nuclear programme by up to 2 yrs: Pentagon
content: US intelligence reports indicate military actions significantly impacted Iran's nuclear program. Pentagon sources suggest a setback of about two years. US forces struck Iranian nuclear facilities using bombers and cruise missiles. Israel also conducted aerial operations targeting Iranian installations and personnel. These actions followed failed diplomatic efforts by then US President Donald Trump to address concerns about Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Classy, Calm, Fearless' - Sachin, Yuvraj lead praise for Gill & Jaiswal
content: Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal shone brightly on Day 1 of the second Test against England, earning accolades from cricket legends like Sachin Tendulkar and Yuvraj Singh. Their impressive partnership helped India recover from early setbacks, with Gill's unbeaten century and Jaiswal's fluent knock putting India in a commanding position at stumps. Gill's captaincy and batting prowess were particularly praised.

title: Quad moves to weaken China's rare-earths grip
content: The Quad nations—India, US, Japan, and Australia—have launched a critical minerals initiative to diversify supply chains and reduce reliance on China, addressing concerns about economic coercion and price manipulation. Foreign ministers from the Quad also voiced concerns over China's actions in the East and South China Seas, opposing any unilateral attempts to alter the status quo.

title: India-US trade: Vietnam deal raises red flags; GTRI urges New Delhi to tread carefully
content: A new US-Vietnam trade agreement, imposing a flat 20% tariff on Vietnamese exports, is causing concern in Asian markets. The deal replaces a previous agreement with preferential access, potentially disrupting Vietnam's $135 billion export flow.

title: 3 Indians abducted in Mali: MEA calls it 'deplorable'; seeks urgent action
content: India has expressed grave concern over the abduction of three Indian nationals in Mali, who were employees of Diamond Cement Factory in Kayes. The abduction occurred during a coordinated armed assault on July 1. India has urged the Malian government to ensure the safe and swift release of its citizens, while the Indian embassy is working closely with local authorities.

title: Dalai Lama succession dispute: Who he is and how his successor is chosen?
content: The Dalai Lama succession dispute has become a potential flashpoint in India-China relations, as the 14th Dalai Lama rules out any Chinese role in naming his successor. While China insists on a state-controlled selection process, India has maintained silence. The issue raises complex questions of religion, politics, and sovereignty. For students, it’s a vital example of how history, diplomacy, and spiritual autonomy intersect in global affairs, especially in the context of Tibet and regional geopolitics.

title: US welcomes foreign students to apply for visa but issues stark warning
content: The US State Department has emphasized that applicants for student visas must understand the visa's purpose is to study, not to disrupt campuses or obstruct other students. Deputy spokesperson Mignon Houston stressed that visa decisions prioritize national security.

title: Sunny Deol travels like a king: Gym gear and cooks in tow
content: Bollywood faces rising entourage costs affecting film budgets. Puneet Issar recalls Sunny Deol’s lavish yet responsible travel since Border (1997), with gym equipment and cooks, without burdening producers. He notes big stars like Rajesh Khanna and Dharmendra also had large entourages, making it a longstanding industry tradition.

title: Hina Khan says she had to throw all her hair care products because of her cancer diagnosis
content: Hina Khan, known for her role in Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai, is battling stage three breast cancer and recently married Rocky Jaiswal. Due to her cancer diagnosis and subsequent hair loss, Hina revealed she had to discard many expired hair-care products. She expressed regret over the waste but acknowledged learning a valuable lesson about prioritizing health.

title: Kolkata horror: 'Mango' was 'confident' assault video would keep survivor mum
content: Monojit Mishra, the primary suspect in the law student gang-rape case, instructed aides to monitor the police station after the crime. He and another accused contacted college officials and seniors for help, but were refused. Mishra and another accused were arrested near Ballygunge railway station, with police collecting evidence, including a bed cover from the scene.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 83,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, started trade on a flat note on Thursday. While Nifty50 was above 25,500, BSE Sensex was in red.

title: Kohli once revealed in-laws accepted him from ‘day one’; called father-in-law his ‘friend’
content: Virat Kohli cherishes a deep bond with Anushka Sharma's family, emphasizing their immediate acceptance and warmth. He particularly values his friendship with his father-in-law, Ajay Kumar Sharma, admiring his fearless perspective. Virat appreciates the mutual respect and unconditional love he shares with Anushka's parents and brother, highlighting how seamlessly he integrated into their family.

title: IND v ENG: Boundaries brought in for Bazball? Ex-Eng cricketer's claim raises eyebrows
content: Captain Shubman Gill's unbeaten century, coupled with Ravindra Jadeja's support, propelled India to 310/5 on Day 1 at Edgbaston. Former England pacer Steven Finn noted the shortened boundaries, linking it to England's 'Bazball' approach. Gill's captaincy and Jaiswal's aggressive start put India in a strong position despite Woakes' early breakthroughs.

title: South China Sea of 'great concern': India's clear message to Beijing at Quad Summit
content: During the Quad Foreign Ministers' Meeting in Washington, S Jaishankar highlighted the South China Sea as a significant concern for the member nations. The Quad expressed a unified stance on maintaining peace and preventing conflict in the waterway, opposing unilateral actions that alter the status quo.

title: 'Because I fight for working people': Mamdani on why Trump wants him arrested
content: New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani refuted Donald Trump's calls for his arrest and deportation, asserting that the attacks stemmed from his advocacy for working people, not his identity. Mamdani criticized Trump's policies, including the "Big Beautiful Bill," accusing him of betraying the working class and favoring the wealthy.

title: Government indifferent as farmers sink deeper into debt: Rahul on Maharashtra farmer deaths
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the government of ignoring farmers’ demands for a loan waiver and a legal guarantee for minimum support price (MSP) for crops

title: PM Narendra Modi 5-nation tour LIVE: Prime Minister to interact with Indian diaspora in Ghana
content: The Prime Minister is expected to be a part of several events during his five-nation tour, including the BRICS summit in Brazil

title: Tamil Nadu Rainbow Coalition criticises Thol. Thirumavalavan’s remarks on same-sex love
content: In a video clip that has gone viral, a youngster, during an event, seeks Mr. Thirumavalavan’s views on same-sex love, to which he responds that it is a form of “perversion”.

title: Search operation underway in J&K's Kishtwar
content: The cordon and search operation follows an encounter that broke out between terrorists and security forces in the heavily forested Kanzal Mandu area of the Kuchal-Chatroo belt

title: Skeletal remains found during recombing at Telangana pharma factory blast site
content: Telangana government-appointed expert committee is scheduled to make their first visit to the site today

title: Delhi HC restrains Patanjali from running 'disparaging' advertisements against Dabur Chyawanprash
content: Delhi High Court restrains Patanjali from disparaging Dabur Chyawanprash in advertisements, with further hearing scheduled for July 14

title: Private school management associations in Andhra Pradesh defer protest after assurance by government officials
content: In a statement, the members said that extended discussions with the government officials concluded on a positive note and “our concerns have been taken to the notice of HRD Minister, along with a clear assurance for resolution”

title: Telangana CM to launch statewide distribution of new ration cards on July 14: Uttam Kumar Reddy
content: The Minster said that efforts were underway to resume the long-stalled Srisailam Left Bank Canal (SLBC) works

title: Andhra Minister Kondapalli Srinivas seeks bankers cooperation for entrepreneurs
content: Kondapalli Srinivas said State Bank of India had been playing a vital role in the economic development of Andhra Pradesh

title: In pictures: Amarnath Yatra begins in Kashmir
content: The annual Amarnath Yatra began on July 3, 2025, with the first batches of pilgrims setting off from the twin base camps in Baltal and Nunwan towards the 3880-metre-high cave shrine in the south Kashmir Himalayas

title: Three militants arrested; arms, ammunition seized in Manipur
content: Security forces seized a .303 rifle with magazine, two 9mm pistols with magazines, one 12-bore single-barrel gun, four hand-grenades, a wireless set with charger and two detonators

title: Air India cancels Delhi-Washington flight; says extended maintenance work due to technical snag found during stopover in Vienna
content: The airline emphasised that the decision was made in line with its “voluntary enhanced pre-flight safety checks” initiative, part of its broader efforts to ensure operational safety and minimise last-minute inconveniences

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Key witness alleges threat to life, seeks armed police protection
content: Mr. Saktheeswaran, in his plea to the DGP, said he feared for his life as well as the safety of his family members

title: Fire at tyre manufacturing unit in Hyderabad’s Katedan industrial area
content: Three fire engines were deployed to contain the blaze at a tyre manufacturing unit in Katedan, which was brought under control after several hours.

title: Devotee booked for making ‘false claim’ of cockroach in laddu prasadam at Srisailam
content: An inquiry by the temple officials revealed that the devotee had intentionally placed a locust in the laddu and made false claims that he found a cockroach in it

title: Landslide near Sonprayag; Kedarnath yatra temporarily suspended in Uttarakhand
content: The road has been completely blocked by the landslide debris and stones at Munkatiya sliding zone, prompting the administration to stop the yatra temporarily

title: Fire breaks out near Sri Govindaraja Swamy temple in Tirupati
content: The cause of the fire was attributed to short circuit in one of the shops on the street leading to  Sri Govindaraja Swamy temple

title: TTD warns contract employees of ‘dire consequences’ if they try to affect devotee services
content: The management is ready to address the genuine issues raised by the workers, but any step that impedes the working of the temple will be seriously dealt with, it warns

title: Man enters Pune woman's home posing as courier delivery agent, rapes her
content: The accused also clicked a selfie on the victim's phone and left a message on it, warning her not to inform about the crime to anyone as he had taken her pictures and would share them on social media

title: Sivaganga youth’s custodial death: AIADMK, BJP cadres condemn DMK govt.
content: The leaders of the AIADMK and the BJP visited victim Ajith Kumar’s house and consoled the family members

title: West Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh visits CPI(M) leader Anil Das who was ‘assaulted’ by TMC woman
content: An FIR has been filed against Trinamool Congress leader Baby Kole against the assault, but she has not been arrested yet drawing backlash from the BJP leadership.

title: Message conveyed with great clarity: Jaishankar on objective of Operation Sindoor
content: A joint statement issued by Quad Foreign Ministers unequivocally condemned all acts of terrorism and violent extremism in all their forms and manifestations, including cross-border terrorism

title: Kolkata college gang rape: Police trying to get details of accused Monojit's meetings before arrest
content: The investigators were also checking if the other two accused — Zaib Ahmed and Pramit Mukherjee — also contacted any person before they were picked up by the police

title: Apache helicopters set for delivery within two weeks after India-U.S. defence talks
content: The first batch of three Apache AH-64E attack helicopters will be delivered by July 15 and the next batch of three helicopters will be delivered by November 2025, sources said

title: Are gig workers a part of India’s labour data?
content: Though gig work is technically included under economic activity in the Periodic Labour Force Survey, without a specific classification, the survey fails to offer visibility into the unique nature of digital labour, characterised by multiple job roles, dependence on algorithms, lack of formal contract and absence of safety metrics

title: Case against Pawan Kalyan in Tamil Nadu an attack on Sanātana Dharma, says BJP State president Madhav
content: Calling the DMK government a tyranny, A.P. State BJP chief alleged that it had repeatedly targeted sacred institutions, sought to dismantle traditional values, and harboured contempt for the Vedas and Vedic culture.

title: Singaiah’s death: A.P. CM Naidu sees bid to distort facts
content: The YSRCP leaders have forced the victim’s wife to say that his condition turned critical in the ambulance, alleges the Chief Minister

title: India, U.S. to ink 10-year defence framework: Pentagon
content: In the phone conversation on Tuesday, Mr. Singh urged Mr. Hegseth to expedite the delivery of GE F404 engines to power the Tejas Light Combat Aircraft, people familiar with the matter said

title: BJP accuses Tejashwi Yadav of appeasement politics over Waqf Act
content: BJP MP Jagdambika Pal on Wednesday accused RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav of misleading Muslims with his remarks on the amended Waqf Act ahead of the Bihar Assembly elections. Pal said the Act aims to ensure transparency and benefit poor and backward sections of the community

title: Second batch of pilgrims leave for Amarnath yatra from Jammu
content: The yatra started early morning from the twin tracks— the traditional 48-km Nunwan-Pahalgam route and the 14-km Baltal route

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder: 3 accused remanded to judicial custody
content: The three were arrested from Madhya Pradesh on the charge of concealing evidence in the murder. On June 26, they had been remanded to police custody for six days

title: Three Indians abducted in Mali amid Al-Qaeda-claimed terrorist attack; India asks West African nation to secure their safe release
content: "The incident occurred on July 1, when a group of armed assailants carried out a coordinated attack at the factory premises and forcibly took three Indian nationals as hostages," the MEA said

title: Triplicane High Road grapples with traffic snarls, crumbling infrastructure
content: Triplicane High Road sees heavy daily activity, but its narrow design and poor infrastructure can’t support the load

title: SHO suspended for beating auto-driver in Bihar’s Sheikhpura
content: Victim allege that the police officer used casteist remarks against him and forced him to lick his own spit; police denied the charges

title: U.P. school merger plan anti-poor, should be dropped: Mayawati
content: The U.P. government is planning to merge schools having enrolment of less than 50 students with nearby educational facilities to make the education system “more functional and viable”.

title: Odisha civil servants announce to go on mass leave demanding arrest of BJP leader
content: The protest comes in the wake of the brutal attack on Ratnakar Sahoo, Additional Commissioner of the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation, who was dragged from his office and beaten by BJP workers.

title: Major chunk of biodegradable waste processed in compost plants in Ernakulam
content: Of the 780 tonnes of biodegradable waste generated a day, around 570 tonnes are being processed at compost plants

title: NDA will form govt. in Bihar with two-thirds majority, says Rajnath
content:
Addressing meeting of the Bihar unit of BJP in Patna, Defence Minister targets RJD for ‘decades
of injustice’ and asserts that only the ruling alliance can bring back the ‘lost glory’ of the State

title: Steps sought to address frequent snarl-ups on Kozhikode-Kannur NH
content: Ambulance operators allege non-compliance with traffic control norms by road construction workers; they also say lane discipline violations by private bus operators worsening the situation

title: Fake cardiologist row: NHRC directs Centre for nationwide verification of cath labs
content: In its report, the NHRC has also flagged ‘serious irregularities’ in the implementation of Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Aarogya Yojana

title: Tourism entrepreneurs in Kozhikode on a sticky wicket
content: Bad weather conditions, safety concerns and lack of facilities at ecotourism spots badly affect entrepreneurs who run farmstays and homestays; shoddy condition of roads adds to their woes

title: India now sole govt. with vote in emoji, text standards body Unicode Consortium
content: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology rejoins the Unicode Consortium as a Supporting Member, procuring a seat at the table for India in the text and emoji standardisation body

title: Silence after the Sigachi blast: families wait for missing victims, officials stay mum
content: A 20-year-old had reported for his first day at work on that fateful day while another, just 10 months into the job, was planning to visit his family in Uttar Pradesh in November

title: Air pollution is a greater threat than tobacco, says doctor
content: He said the rise of non-communicable diseases such as cancer, diabetes, and cardiovascular disorders has overtaken communicable diseases as dominant health burden in India, particularly in southern States

title: Operating the Sigachi plant for 35 years without a single incident, says MD
content: Company said an internal safety review has been initiated and Sigachi remains committed to cooperating with all legal, safety, and regulatory audits to strengthen safety norms

title: Six minor girls ‘trapped in horrific conditions’ rescued from orchestra groups in Bihar
content: The rescued girls were trafficked from New Delhi, West Bengal, and Nepal. The operation was carried out based on intelligence provided by Narayani Seva Sansthan, and inputs from the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC)

title: Commuters say recent speed restrictions on west section cause delay in train services
content: The Southern Railway has directed the loco-pilots of the suburban trains operated from Moore Market complex to Arakkonam, via Avadi and Tiruvallur, to maintain a speed of 15 km per hour at 12 places

title: Pune-based hospital performs bilateral lung transplant on Army soldier
content: With approvals from the Zonal Transplant Coordination Centre, a green corridor was established to bring the organs from Dombivli to Pune in under two hours

title: Jammu and Kashmir Police warn action against people circulating content related to ‘removal of flag’ in Srinagar
content: The police directive comes hours after protests broke out over the alleged removal of a banner set up for a Muharram procession in Srinagar’s Saida Kadal area by the J&K Police

title: India not just a partner but co-traveller in Ghana’s development journey: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi said both sides have set a target of doubling the two-way trade in the next five years and that India is not just a partner but a co-traveller in Ghana’s development journey

title: Maharashtra Assembly members seek revival of live snake worship tradition in Battis Shirala
content: Members of the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly on Wednesday called for the revival of the traditional practice of worshipping live snakes during Nag Panchami in Battis Shirala, Sangli district. The practice was banned by the Bombay High Court in 2002 following concerns raised by wildlife activists.

title: Tamil Nadu government launches door delivery of essential commodities in Chennai, nine districts on a pilot basis
content: Apart from Chennai, the pilot project covers Cuddalore, Ranipet, Tirunelveli, Erode, Sivaganga, Nagapattinam, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, and the Nilgiris

title: Two arrested in Rayachoti of Andhra Pradesh for suspected terror links
content: Tamil Nadu ATS officials nab the suspects for their alleged involvement in terror cases reported from Tamil Nadu and Karnataka; the duo, reportedly brothers, had been living under aliases in Rayachoti for the past three decades

title: Special cells to reopen cases of militancy victims in J&K
content: The latest initiative will identify perpetrators currently engaged in government service; the affected families can contact the helpline numbers on all working days

title: Parliament's Monsoon session from July 21 to August 21
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said President Droupadi Murmu has approved the government's proposal to convene the Session from July 21 to August 21.

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Complainant against victim was accused of cheating
content: J.P. Nikitha was among the six accused in a cheating and forgery case dating back to 2011. They had defrauded job-seekers of ₹16 lakh

title: Congress trying to bring ‘anti-secular’ Jamaat-e-Islami into mainstream politics, alleges Kerala BJP leader
content: The Congress was now aligning with the outfit as part of its opportunistic politics, Kerala BJP president Rajeev Chandrasekhar said

title: Axiom-4 trip to the ISS will provide valuable inputs for Gaganyaan mission: ISRO
content: ISRO’s Ax-04 mission provides crucial insights for Gaganyaan, including crew integration, medical and  psychological preparation, and cultural representation in space

title: NDA has broken old image of ‘jungle raj’ in Bihar, says Rajnath Singh
content: He also reminded of Jungle Raj saying that today the resolution of BJP is not only to get power, it is a retaliation for the historical injustice that Bihar has suffered for decades.

title: Three Kanwar Yatra pilgrims die after their truck fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand
content: A group of over 60 pilgrims were going towards Uttarkashi district to set up a Kanwar camp near Gangotri and Yamunotri temples, say police

title: ED files 5th supplementary prosecution complaint in illegal mining case in Jharkhand’s Sahibganj
content: The ED has so far seized and frozen assets including over ₹5.34 Crore in cash, an inland vessel, five industrial stone crushers, multiple vehicles, and bank balances exceeding ₹13.32 Crore.

title: Supreme Court permits M3M real estate developer to swap attached property
content: The move seemed to balance the state’s interest in the strict implementation of the law and allowing business continuity

title: Prada to engage with Kolhapuri chappal artisans, Maharashtra industry body
content: MACCIA proposes joint working group for co-branding initiative; video meeting scheduled for next week

title: SFI, DYFI protest against suspension of Kerala University Registrar
content: They warn of larger protests to counter the threats posed by those who have aligned with the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh. Vice-Chancellor has no legal authority to suspend Registrar

title: Baseless claims linking Covid vaccines to sudden deaths can hamper vaccination programmes: Director, National Institute of Epidemiology
content: Research has, in fact, indicated the positive effect of vaccinations, Manoj V. Murhekar said, emphasising that Covid vaccines did not increase the risk of sudden deaths among young adults the Director of the India Council of Medical Research-National Institute of Epidemiology said

title: Khalistani separatist’s kin in U.K. call for inquest
content: Michael Polak, a lawyer for the deceased’s family, alleged that samples were not tested for potential cancer-inducing agents, according to a report by The Guardian

title: Kershaw becomes MLB's 4th lefty with 3,000 K's
content: Clayton Kershaw joined Randy Johnson, Steve Carlton and CC Sabathia as the only left-handers in MLB history to reach 3,000 strikeouts, pulling the feat Wednesday night in the Dodgers' 5-4 win over the White Sox.

title: Muncy (knee) helped off but Dodgers 'optimistic'
content: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said the "hope" is Max Muncy sustained only a sprain in a collision with the White Sox's Michael A. Taylor.

title: Raleigh, rookie Wilson among All-Star starters
content: Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh, MLB's home run leader, and AL League Rookie of the Year candidate Jacob Wilson of the Athletics are among the All-Star Game starters.

title: Mets' Lindor ends long slump after lineup change
content: Francisco Lindor was dropped from the leadoff spot for the first time in 191 consecutive starts Wednesday night and helped the Mets end a four-game losing skid.

title: Sources: Ayton to sign 2-year deal with Lakers
content: Former No. 1 pick Deandre Ayton, who finalized a buyout with the Blazers on Sunday, will sign a two-year deal with the Lakers, sources told ESPN.

title: Poch: 'Desperate' Luna sets example for USMNT
content: ST. LOUIS -- United States coach Mauricio Pochettino praised goal scorer Diego Luna for being "desperate to play" for the national team after the winger scored twice in a 2-1 Gold Cup semifinal win over Guatemala on Wednesday.

title: Bronny: Not focused on speculation about LeBron
content: While speculation swirls about LeBron James' future, Bronny James is working out with the Lakers' summer league team and was told by his dad "to not worry about it."

title: Red Panda has broken wrist, is out of hospital
content: Red Panda's recovery should take a few months, her agency said the day after she fell off her unicycle and crashed to the court during halftime of the WNBA Commissioner's Cup final.

title: 💰 8 NFL players who excel at 'securing the bag'
content: Which NFL players have negotiated the most profitable contracts over their careers? Bill Barnwell gives his picks.

title: Luna eclipse: No stars, no problem as USMNT finds new focal point
content: Diego Luna was the shining star for the USMNT in St. Louis against Guatemala, as Mauricio Pochettino's side marches on to the Gold Cup final.

title: Aces to Dodgers and Cubs? A star closer for Phillies? One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: The deadline is a month away. Could players such as Eugenio Suarez and Emmanuel Clase finish the season on a different team?

content: Which stars are available? Which teams need them? Kevin Pelton reveals his updated top 10, now including a former MVP.

content: Damian Lillard waived, Myles Turner to Milwaukee. What do the moves mean for the Bucks, Pacers and the NBA?

title: Lavelle & Co. are responding well to Hayes' USWNT challenges
content: After Emma Hayes set expectations high ahead of Wednesday's clash with Canada, the USWNT responded with an exceptional performance.

title: USMNT’s grit, character are shining at Gold Cup, and that will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure.

title: Is this the best era yet in women's tennis? Why the depth is truly unprecedented
content: Gauff, Sabalenka and Swiatek are quickly becoming stars, but they are far from the only great players.

title: PGA Tour Power Rankings: Scottie Scheffler and then who comes next?
content: No. 1 is obvious, but who comes after Scheffler in our ranking of the 25 best players on the PGA Tour ahead of the final major of the season?

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: How the Fever rallied past the Lynx to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup
content: Playing without Caitlin Clark, Indiana had its best defensive effort of 2025 to win the Commissioner's Cup.

title: Added touch: Opportunity knocks for these players in 2025
content: Who will benefit most from teams' vacated touches from last season? Eric Moody discusses the players poised to seize the opportunity.

title: The Mock Draft project: 2025's most wanted fantasy football picks
content: We put our experts through the paces of multiple mock drafts to derive the ultimate average draft positions.

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: Inside the MLB draft journey for the sons of two former major leaguers
content: They share a home state, have ex-MLB outfielders for dads -- and took two very different paths to the top of the draft.

title: A new kind of mock draft: Our insiders make the picks for all 30 teams -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Switzerland swelters as tournament begins
content: Switzerland's temperatures skyrocketed, while Iceland's fans took center stage. Here's what you need to know from Wednesday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Jiménez propels Mexico to Gold Cup final vs. U.S.
content: Raúl Jiménez scored the winning goal for Mexico against Honduras in Wednesday's Gold Cup semifinal, securing their spot in a title defense matchup against the United States.

title: WC hosts can serve Gold Cup bans in friendlies
content: Concacaf confirmed on Wednesday that any red card suspensions incurred by players from the United States, Canada or Mexico during the Gold Cup will be served in their next international friendly match, rather than carrying over to next year's World Cup.

title: Stoney slams 'inexcusable' Canada loss to USWNT
content: WASHINGTON -- Canada head coach Casey Stoney said her team's performance in Wednesday's 3-0 loss to the United States at Audi Field was "inexcusable."

title: Giroud on LAFC: MLS style of play 'didn't suit me'
content: Veteran striker Olivier Giroud explained his underwhelming spell at LAFC by saying that the style of play in MLS 'didn't necessarily suit me."

title: Courtois: Alexander-Arnold a 'nightmare' for GKs
content: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois is very impressed by Trent Alexander-Arnold's "unbelievable" crossing ability, saying his new teammate is a "nightmare" for goalkeepers.

title: Sources: Canada's David to sign for Juventus
content: Juventus have agreed a deal to sign Canada international Jonathan David on a free from Lille, sources have told ESPN.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: After Ilia Topuria's title-winning KO, who's No. 1 now?
content: Does the new lightweight champion leapfrog Islam Makhachev, who vacated the title, in ESPN's latest rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus make move for Sancho
content: Manchester United want £25m from the transfer of Jadon Sancho amid interest in the winger from Juventus. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Barcelona unveil 2025-26 home kit for return to Camp Nou
content: Lamine Yamal and Barcelona will be wearing the club's classic stripes but with a modern twist when they go home to Camp Nou after two years at Montjuïc.

title: What to know ahead of the British Grand Prix at Silverstone
content: Round 12 of the 2025 Formula 1 season is at Silverstone, as it hosts the British Grand Prix and celebrates 75 years of the pinnacle of motorsport.

title: Gujarat Becomes Third State With Over 1 Crore Stock Market Investors
content: The number of people joining stock markets are surging continuously in India, now Gujarat has become the third Indian state to cross the 1-crore mark in registered investors, according to the latest data released by the National Stock Exchange (NSE).

title: Centre Seeks Consensus From All Parties On Impeachment Of Judge In Cash Row
content: The Centre has sought consensus from all parties on the removal of Judge Yashwant Varma, who is facing allegations of corruption after the discovery of a large amount of cash from his official residence in Delhi.

title: Pick Up Trash, Get Free Stuff: Copenhagen's 'CopenPay' Rewards Tourists
content: Mexican tourist Rocio Gomez spent an hour boating on Copenhagen's canals free of charge in exchange for picking up trash in the water, part of a city programme for rewarding eco-friendly tourists.

title: "Unacceptable": US After Iran Halts Deal With UN Nuclear Watchdog
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has signed a new law halting his country's cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The step has drawn criticism from the US.

title: Once A Hip-Hop Mogul, Sean 'Diddy' Combs Is Now A Convicted Felon
content: As recently as 2023, Combs was still on top of the world, but his fame plummeted rapidly in November of that year, when his former partner of 11 years, Casandra Ventura, filed a civil suit with a litany of allegations including a 2018 rape.

title: Forced To Go For Tuition, 14-Year-Old Boy Jumps From Mumbai Building, Dies
content: A 14-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide after his mother forced him to attend his tuition classes in Mumbai, police said on Thursday.

title: "We'll Cross The Bridge When We Get There": S Jaishankar On 500% Tariff Threat Over Russian Oil
content: India is engaging with American lawmakers over concerns surrounding a new Russia sanctions bill introduced in the US Congress, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar said on Wednesday.

title: Opinion: Blog | Goondaism To Corruption, 'Mango' Mishra Is All That's Wrong With Bengal
content: A priest's son who became a lawyer bunks the courtroom, takes on a handout job, and aims to make money through bribes. This is not just corruption, but a deep rot.

title: "Grow Up, Eat Meat": Stand Up Comedian Says Vegans Need "Professional Help"
content: Stand-up comedian Saniya Mirwani has said that she pities vegans, adding they need professional help.

title: Uttarakhand Landslide: Disaster Response Force Rescues 40 Stranded Pilgrims
content: Amid relentless rainfall and deteriorating weather conditions in Uttarakhand, around 40 devotees returning from the Kedarnath Dham were rescued by the State Disaster Response Force on Thursday after being stranded near the Sonprayag landslide

title: On Camera, Bengaluru Cafe Staff Assaulted Over Extra Coffee Cup
content: A staff member at a popular Bengaluru coffee joint was brutally assaulted yesterday evening after refusing to provide an extra coffee cup to a customer. The entire incident was captured on CCTV cameras installed at the cafe.

title: Woman Refuses To Return Home, Husband Kills Her Parents In Lucknow
content: A man allegedly killed his in-laws with a sharp edged weapon after his wife refused to return to her matrimonial home, police said on Thursday.

title: Kolkata Student Was Raped On Camera. 'Mango' Was Sure She Won't Go To Cops
content: Monojit 'Mango' Mishra, prime accused in the Kolkata law college rape case, has told police that he believed that the threat to circulate the sex assault video would stop the 24-year-old survivor from approaching cops.

title: 4 Dead, 38 Missing After Ferry Sinks On Way To Indonesia's Bali
content: At least four people were dead and dozens unaccounted for Thursday after a ferry sank on its way to the resort island of Bali, according to local authorities who said 23 survivors had been plucked from the water so far.

title: Snag On Air India Delhi-US Flight, It Is Cancelled During Fuel Stop In Vienna
content: An Air India flight from Delhi to Washington was halted at Vienna and cancelled subsequently after an "extended maintenance task" was identified during refueling in the Austrian capital, an airline spokesperson said on Thursday.

title: Husband Kills Man Over Suspicion Of Having Affair With Wife, Surrenders: Cops
content: A 24-year-old man allegedly attacked another man with a sharp weapon over suspicion that the latter was having an affair with his wife, and then surrendered before police in Mumbai, an official said on Thursday.

title: 'Big Comrade': Former Defence Chief Takes Reins As Thai PM
content: Thailand's former defence chief is set to be appointed acting prime minister on Thursday, capping a colourful career for the political heavyweight once nicknamed "Big Comrade".

title: Mini Trade Deal With US In 48 Hours, India Pushing For Concessions: Sources
content: An interim trade deal between India and the United States is likely to be finalised in the next 48 hours, with negotiations underway in Washington, sources told NDTV on Thursday.

title: Biocon Chief Counters Siddaramaiah's Covid Vaccine-Heart Attack Link Claim
content: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has pushed back against Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's recent claim that COVID-19 vaccines may be linked to a surge in sudden cardiac deaths in Hassan district.

title: João Pedro signs for Chelsea in $82M deal
